p:
The cytotoxicity of NAR diverges, depending on the given cell line
48, 50 . A 250 μM concentration of NAR could be used in human hepatoma cell culture (Huh7.5) without toxic effects
18 . Here, the toxicity of NAR to A549 was demonstrated to be concentration-dependent, and 125 µM (MNTC) was considered safe. For the other assayed cell lines or primary cells (Huh7.5, A172, hmdDCs and NKX2-5 eGFP/whESC), the same concentration was also non-toxic. However, higher cytotoxicity has been previously observed for primary human monocytes treated with NAR
18 . In vivo, NAR seems to be well absorbed and tolerated by mice, and also protects rats from dimethylnitrosamine-induced liver damage
51, 52 .
